evidence.text: NOTICE OF APPEAL as to 125 Memorandum Decision, Terminate Motions by Speaker of the Idaho House of Representatives Scott Bedke, Idaho Senate President Pro Tempore Chuck Winder, and the Sixty-Sixth Idaho Legislature. Filing Fee Paid. $ 505, receipt number AIDDC-2530532. (Notice sent to Court Reporter & 9th Cir) (Bower, Daniel)

extracted.value: Appeal: Speaker of the Idaho House of Representatives Scott Bedke, Idaho Senate President Pro Tempore Chuck Winder, and the Sixty-Sixth Idaho Legislature appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

evidence.text: NOTICE OF APPEAL (USCA 23-35440) as to 95 Order on Motion for Preliminary Injunction, 135 Order on Motion for Reconsideration,,, by State of Idaho. Filing Fee Due. $ 505, receipt number AIDDC-2590508. (Notice sent to Court Reporter & 9th Cir) (Wilson, Lincoln)

extracted.value: Appeal: State of Idaho appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

evidence.text: MEMORANDUM DECISION AND ORDER granting in part and denying in part 15 Motion to Intervene. Signed by Judge B Lynn Winmill.

extracted.value: Court granted in part and denied in part Idaho Legislature's Motion to Intervene on August 13, 2022, allowing limited intervention for certain claims

evidence.text: MEMORANDUM DECISION AND ORDER. Legislatures request for an evidentiary hearingis DENIED. Signed by Judge B Lynn Winmill.

extracted.value: Court denied Idaho Legislature's request for evidentiary hearing on August 17, 2022, citing undue prejudice to United States

evidence.text: DOCKET ENTRY ORDER: Before the Court is the Idaho Legislature's Motion for Leave to File Legal Arguments 69. ... IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that the Legislature's Motion for Leave to File Legal Arguments 69 is DENIED.

extracted.value: Court denied Idaho Legislature's Motion for Leave to File Legal Arguments on August 17, 2022, citing exceeding page limits and prejudice to United States

evidence.text: DOCKET ENTRY ORDER: The American Center for Law & Justice's 74 Motion for Leave to file Amicus Brief in Support of Defendant's Response to Plaintiff's Motion for Preliminary Injunction is GRANTED. The ACLJ is directed to formally file its [74-1] Proposed Brief.

extracted.value: Court granted American Center for Law & Justice's Motion to File Amicus Brief on August 17, 2022, directing formal filing of proposed brief

evidence.text: DOCKET ENTRY ORDER: 87 Unopposed Motion for Leave to File Brief of Indiana and 16 Other States as Amici Curiae in Support of Defendant is GRANTED. Amici are directed to file their [87-2] Proposed Brief.

extracted.value: Court granted Indiana and 16 other states' Motion for Leave to File Amicus Brief on August 19, 2022, directing formal filing of proposed brief

evidence.text: DOCKET ENTRY ORDER GRANTING Motion for Extension of Time to Answer or Otherwise Respond (Dkt. 77 ). The State of Idaho shall answer or other respond by September 23, 2022.

extracted.value: Court granted State of Idaho's Motion for Extension of Time to File Answer on August 17, 2022, extending deadline to September 23, 2022

evidence.text: MOTION for Preliminary Injunction Lisa Newman appearing for Plaintiff United States of America. Responses due by 8/29/2022

extracted.value: United States filed Motion for Preliminary Injunction on August 8, 2022, seeking to halt enforcement of Idaho's abortion restrictions with responses due August 29, 2022

evidence.text: Expedited MOTION to Intervene Daniel W. Bower, Monte N Stewart appearing for Intervenor Defendant Speaker of the Idaho House of Representatives Scott Bedke, Idaho Senate President Pro Tempore Chuck Winder, and the Sixty-Sixth Idaho Legislature. Responses due by 8/29/2022

extracted.value: Idaho Legislature filed Expedited Motion to Intervene on August 8, 2022, seeking to join as intervenors representing legislative leadership

evidence.text: MOTION to Expedite Idaho Legislatures Motion to Intervene Daniel W. Bower appearing for Intervenor Defendant Speaker of the Idaho House of Representatives Scott Bedke, Idaho Senate President Pro Tempore Chuck Winder, and the Sixty-Sixth Idaho Legislature. Responses due by 8/29/2022

extracted.value: Idaho Legislature filed Motion to Expedite on August 8, 2022, seeking expedited consideration of their Motion to Intervene

evidence.text: No trial was scheduled or held in this case; the case proceeded on motions for preliminary injunction and related matters as documented in the Docket (entries 92, 131, etc.).
